general.scope: All patterns refer exclusively to the standard candlestick chart used in trading.

Doji.description: A candle with a very small or no real body where the opening and closing prices are almost or exactly the same. It signals market indecision and may indicate a potential trend reversal.

types.Standard Doji: Opening and closing prices are nearly identical, showing market indecision.
types.Long-Legged Doji: Long upper and lower wicks indicating high volatility and balance between bulls and bears.
types.Dragonfly Doji: Closing price near the high, suggesting a reversal from bearish to bullish.
types.Gravestone Doji: Opening price near the high, suggesting a reversal from bullish to bearish.

Hammer.description: A single candle with a small body and a long lower wick. It signals a possible reversal from bearish to bullish and should appear after a downtrend.

Shooting Star.description: A single candle with a small body and a long upper wick. It indicates a possible reversal from bullish to bearish and should appear after an uptrend.

Bullish Engulfing.description: A two-candle pattern where a small bearish candle is fully engulfed by a larger bullish candle. It suggests a reversal from bearish to bullish.

Bearish Engulfing.description: A two-candle pattern where a small bullish candle is engulfed by a larger bearish candle. It suggests a reversal from bullish to bearish.

Piercing Pattern.description: A two-candle pattern where a large bearish candle is partially engulfed by a bullish candle. It may indicate a reversal from bearish to bullish.

Dark Cloud Cover.description: A two-candle pattern where a large bullish candle is partially engulfed by a bearish candle. It may indicate a reversal from bullish to bearish.

Morning Star.description: A three-candle pattern indicating a reversal from bearish to bullish after a downtrend.

Evening Star.description: A three-candle pattern indicating a reversal from bullish to bearish after an uptrend.

Rising Three Methods.description: A multi-candle continuation pattern suggesting that the uptrend is likely to continue.

Falling Three Methods.description: A multi-candle continuation pattern suggesting that the downtrend is likely to continue.
